oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Overall Bill, Star, and Dresden Plate quilts

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quilts; Quilting
Quilts; Quilting; Folk art
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Overall Bill, Star, and Dresden Plate quilts hanging from a clothesline. The focus is on the Star quilt and only small areas of the other two are visible.

Dresden Plate was a popular quilting pattern of the 1920s and 1930s. It is related to the 19th century Fan pattern. Overall Bill was a pattern related to and often used in alternating blocks with Sunbonnet Sue. Star quilts appeared in England and the eastern United States in the early 1800s.
